metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14245 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
An out of bounds read in the function d2alaw_array() in alaw.c of libsndfile 1.0.28 may lead to a remote DoS attack or information disclosure, related to mishandling of the NAN and INFINITY floating-point values.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14245` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsndfile1 - 1.0.28-6
sndfile-programs - 1.0.28-6
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> reproducer can be found in github link mdeslaur> a-ulaw-fix-multiple-buffer-overflows-432.patch

criterions.comment: libsndfile package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.28-6').
